CatDescriptText: Louise McPherson, fountain manager, Adelaide St. and Wanda Saulsbury, housewife, 1425 Hunter St., Wilkinsburg were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 22, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think Negro voters consider local or national issues in the casting of their votes?" Mrs. McPherson's answer reads: "I would say that the greater number of voters favor the national issues rather than the local ones in their voting."  Mrs. Saulbury's answer reads: "I think the Negro votes more on national issues, because the average Negro votes for civil rights."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Louise McPherson wearing light colored cardigan with embroidered flowers and eyeglasses, standing in front of store window; Portrait of Wanda Saulsbury wearing dark shirt with plaid collar and button placket, standing in front of building with artist supplies sign
